boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Buckler features the collective writings of the DMDave Patreon, bundled together in a convenient zip archive for instant download. The works featured in this installment are from January 1, 2022 – January 31, 2022.

boardgame.name: Buckler February 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Buckler features the collective writings of the DMDave Patreon, bundled together in a convenient zip archive for instant download. The works featured in this installment are from February 1, 2022 – February 28, 2022.

boardgame.name: Quest Calendar: The Voidspark Chronicles
boardgame.description:
An rpg built into a desktop calendar. Choose one of 6 heroes. Go on a campaign that lasts throughout the year with a single event happening each day (weekends combined). Chose how you want to take on the daily challenge. Roll classic rpg dice (7 polyhedral dice) and add your hero's abilities to fight the monster, open the chest, get past guards, etc.

—description from the designer

This sci-fi experience will take you an a grand adventure exploring the Zenula Prime Galaxy, an awe-inspiring place full of beauty, discovery and adventure.

Experience strange lands, weird creatures and cultures and dangerous encounters.

Ultimately, you may make a discovery that could lead to the improvement and everlasting peace for every living creature. Or will this knowledge and power fall into the hands of those corrupt enough to seize control of all existence?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Punks in a Powder Keg
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

A ragtag band of gunslinging outlaws get their hands dirty in the greasy alleyways and whisky-soaked saloons of Alkenstar, the City of Smog. To get revenge on the mogul who destroyed them, the renegades will have to stick up an illicit bank, foil a crooked shieldmarshal, and escort a reclusive inventor to safety. All the while, countless rough-and-tumble rivals aim to waylay the party and seize the inventor's latest concoction: pyronite, an explosive substance with the potential to change the face of the world. In a city where the clockwork guards are literally as tough as brass, the antiheroes will need true grit to dole out overdue justice.

boardgame.name: Estate Sale
boardgame.description:
Overview

You and your family are quietly walking around your neighborhood. Suddenly you hear a commotion around the corner. It seems that EVEYRONE is pouring into a house! One of your neighbors has suddenly left and they are having an ESTATE SALE! You and your family jump on the opportunity to pick up some art; books; furniture; silverware; and clothes from the home. Over the course of the day you all explore the house in an attempt to find long lost treasurers and some hidden gems. You also stop to participate in some instant auctions against the other families in the home. Of course, one person’s trash is another person’s treasure as you learn to dumpster dive for some discarded items. No matter what, you always have to remember to move and buy wisely! At the end of the day the family that scores the most points wins the game!

Summary

Estate Sale is a 1-6 player table top game involving buying; auctioning; and acquiring different items from an estate sale. Players represent families competing against one another to score the most victory points and win the game.

What is an Estate Sale?

An estate sale is a method of selling ALL (or most) of the contents of a home. Estate sales usually happen after the death of an occupant or other event that causes the inhabitants to quickly move away from the home. Estate sales usually take place over several days and are generally open to the public. An estate sale is like a garage sale or a tag sale. The main difference is that an estate sale is meant to dispose of all of a home’s possessions in an orderly manner. Estate sales are much more than a yard sale as EVERYTHING has a price tag. Everything is up for sale.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Blue Moon
boardgame.description:
Overview

Getting a great picture of the moon’s phases is a challenging project! But you’ve set aside the time (and the month) practicing with your telescope’s camera in order to get the best shot possible. But there are other members of your astronomy club who are vying for the same pictures! Compete with your fellow colleagues to practice taking pictures of different phases of the moon over the course of the month in order to score the most amounts of points and claim the title of best astrophotographer!

Summary

Blue Moon is a 1-6 player card game involving open drafting; pattern recognition; pattern building; and scoring different shots of the moon. Players represent members of the astronomy club all competing to get the best photos to score the most victory points and win the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Reise durch das Märchenland
boardgame.description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 66 to win the game. On some spaces events from fairy tales hinder or benefit the players.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Hansel and Gretel

boardgame.name: Twilight Inscription
boardgame.description:
The Lazax Empire has burned to ash, rejected by its subjects. The aftermath was tragedy and petty conflict in equal measure, a time of loss and exhaustion. In the ensuing Dark Years, the factions of the galaxy retreated and recovered their strength. Now, they look upon the stars and see an opportunity—a chance to reclaim what was lost. A chance to redefine galactic civilization. A chance to leave their mark upon the stars.

Twilight Inscription, an epic roll-and-write game for one to eight players, offers an experience unlike anything Fantasy Flight Games has done before. With a limited pool of resources at your disposal, you’ll need to carefully manage Navigation, Expansion, Industry, and Warfare as you amass victory points and earn your right to the throne on Mecatol Rex. Will your faction become the new rulers of the galaxy? Or will your fledgling empire fade into obscurity? Anything can happen in this strategic, infinitely-replayable game!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 12: Top 5 BGG 100 Games We Want to Play

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Morels: 10th Anniversary Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
Contains 11 cards: 5x Chicken of the Woods, 4x Giant Puffball (Day), 1x Giant Puffball (Night), and 1x Moon. They can be added to the deck as is, or can be swapped out for the Chanterelles and their night card.

The booster pack is not planned to be sold by itself except during the Morels 10th Anniversary Kickstarter campaign.

listing.notes:
NEW - sealed
Check out my other items and bundle to save on shipping.

boardgame.name: Monstrous Compendium Volume One: Spelljammer Creatures
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

In the Astral Sea, the cruelest of liches thrive and even the asteroids are suspect. That's what you'll discover in Monstrous Compendium Volume One: Spelljammer Creatures, the first in a series of monthly drops available to all D&D Beyond users! This collection brings 10 new monsters to your fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons campaign, five from classic Spelljammer lore and five that are brand new. You won't find these monsters in Spelljammer: Adventures in Space, either!

boardgame.name: Church of Lies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Quick micro dungeons - Small, quick dungeons for OSR and 5e games.

Intended to be run in one adventuring night, Quick Micro Dungeons are a DM's best friend.

The Ninth installment involves a conspiracy inside of the church. Demonic cultists have taken over these once hallowed grounds and deceive the local populace.

boardgame.name: Dragons of Stormwreck Isle
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




User summary:

A beginner box set with introductory rulebook, adventure book, dice set, and pre-generated and blank character sheets.

boardgame.name: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




User summary:

A return of the classic setting, with an integrated tie-in miniatures battle game, Dragonlance: Warriors of Krynn.

boardgame.name: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




User summary:

A three book, slipcase set, including:

Astral Adventure Guide
Light of Xaryxis
Boo's Astral Menagerie

boardgame.name: Dragonlance: Warriors of Krynn
boardgame.description:
“We zero in on this notion that Dragonlance is a war story,” said Ray Winninger, head of D&D at Wizards. “Classic Dragonlance is set against the backdrop of this massive conflict, and these sort of massive military battles are an important part of Dragonlance. One of the original 12 Dragonlance modules was a wargame Dragons of Glory. They asked you to stop your role-playing game experience and start playing a wargame for a bit.

“[It] allows you to play out sort of massive military battles in the world of Krynn. But one of the interesting things about that game is that it has a lot of narrative elements, just like a role-playing game.”


- Ray Winninger


See also Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen.

boardgame.name: Kaiju Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What is a Kaiju?

To put it simply, Kaiju refers to a genre of film that originated in Japan that featured giant monsters, but it can also refer to the giant monsters themselves.

The actions of these giant monsters are typically devastating to the planet and pose a global threat. This can range from the intentional destruction of infrastructure or the combat between two giant monsters.

What is the Kaiju Generator?

This generator will help you to create a kaiju that you can use in your roleplaying adventures by utilising 4 1d66 random tables and questions to guide the development of relevant plot hooks.

Can your players survive an encounter with a gigantic monster?

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade - Heartless Lullaby
boardgame.description:
Step into the night as Zak Riley and Diane, mortal and Kindred, as their fates intertwine in an ominous plot involving a weakened Camarilla, the vampiric sect that wants to remain hidden, and a rising Sabbat, the fanatical group that sees humanity as cattle.

Meet dozens of characters, venture deep into the shadows and see the world through the eyes of both mortal and vampire, as you explore the Heartless Club.

Take your chances with the dice, face the consequences of your actions, and embrace the duality of Humanity and the Beast in this story rich cRPG set in the World of Darkness.

Covering just the prologue of the story, with well over an hour and a half of gameplay and several different endings, Vampire: The Masquerade - Heartless Lullaby was created in less than a month in celebration of the Vampire: The Masquerade Jam.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Medieval Mishap
boardgame.description:
Agent Lance Steele is Deputy Director of the secretive organisation known as the Ministry of Time, and he’s having a tough day.

His newest Junior Agent has gone missing on their very first assignment. They were sent back in time to investigate a strange anomaly in Medieval England, and nobody has heard from them since.

The only clues are some coded parchments, cryptic journals, bizarre devices, and an unmarked map of… somewhere? Steele suspects there are dark forces at work. And that’s where you come in.

The Medieval Mishap is an immersive puzzle adventure contained entirely in one package. Input your answers on your device, while you play the game in the real world, with beautifully-produced puzzles and your own wits.

boardgame.name: Brand New Zoo
boardgame.description:
Brand New Zoo is a roll and write game where players will attempt to build their best zoo using shared dice results. Each player uses a single printed game sheet and writing utensil, while one player also needs two dice that will be shared.

On a turn, two dice are rolled and all players use the results. Players can use dice to either draw enclosures, hire zoo keepers, or acquire animals. If doubles are rolled, players can choose to charge admission. All animals have different scoring conditions or are worth varying points.

Turns are simultaneous and games last about 20 minutes. Brand New Zoo utilizes a modular expansion system that allows players to use as many expansions as they like. Players can play the base game as an introduction, then mix and match as many expansions as they wish.

boardgame.name: At a Crossroads
boardgame.description:
A Sourcebook for the Jospro Sector

From the introduction:

Mon Mothma has begun Operation Domino, a daring plan calling for localized Rebel cells to seize an Imperial planet and hold it. To date, it has been a terrible failure with hundreds of operatives in dozens of sectors crushed under the Empire’s fist.

But, there is always hope. Can a new band of heroes dive into the Jospro sector and claim victory from the Imperials?

boardgame.name: Capital Ship Combat
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Combat in larger, capital-class starships of silhouette 5 or higher is, by necessity, can be more abstract due to the complexity of the vessels and the number of crew members involved. These rules however hope to allow large scale capital ship combat to become a stable part of your campaign.

boardgame.name: Lightsaber Crystals
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Kyber Crystals are a variety of crystals, gems, stones, or other objects with particular properties found throughout the galaxy.

boardgame.name: Sundered Skies Adventure Codex
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Sundered Skies Adventure Codex!

In this epic tome you will find eight awesome adventures set in the dangerous world of the Sundered Skies.

Follow your destiny and explore a world of shattered floating islands where the glow of the void brings you close to madness.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: きりきりケーキ(Cut Cut Cake)
boardgame.description:
A genius patissier who works at a popular cake shop is great at baking cakes, but not so good at cutting.
So you have been hired at the cake shop to cut the cakes.
Using a pen, draw lines to cut the cakes into many pieces with ordered toppings within the time limit!
Don't worry about their non-uniform size and shapes. It's OK as long as the toppings match! Be the best cutter of all!

ある大人気ケーキ屋さんで働く天才パティシエはケーキ作りは一流だけど、カットは苦手。
君はそんなケーキ屋さんに雇われたカット係。
制限時間内にペンで線を引いてケーキを区切り、注文通りのトッピングのケーキをたくさんカットしよう！
大きさや形がバラバラ?トッピングさえ合っていればOKさ！誰よりも優秀なカット係を目指そう！

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Better Letters
boardgame.description:
Come up with words that meet the criteria set forth by the board. Score points for difficulty and type, and meeting personal and public objectives.

Better Letters is played on a 5 x 5 grid of cards. Set up the game by shuffling the entire deck and dealing out nine cards into a 3 x 3 grid into the middle of the play area. Cards may be placed in any location as long as there are no more than one of each type (color/shape) in a column or row (Sudoku-style). If you are unable to place all nine, discard the duplicates and redraw/refill until the 3x3 grid is complete. Shuffle the personal objective cards and deal out three to each player. Each player will select two to keep and discard the other. These are kept secret from other players. Shuffle the public objective cards and deal out three face-up next to the playing area. Place the three timer cards in order from 1-3 above the public objectives and set the 30-second timer next to them.

Better Letters is played in rounds with all players acting at the same time. Turn over the timer to begin the round and place it on the “1” timer card. Each player’s goal is to form a word(s) by following the restrictions listed on one or multiple cards. You may work from the top, bottom, left or right, in a straight line without skipping any cards (spaces may be ignored) and beginning with a card on the edge. Write down your word(s) on your score sheet in the corresponding round box. At any time, any player may flip over the expired timer and reset the clock on the “2” timer card. When any player is satisfied with their selection of words, they will turn over the expired 30-second timer one last time onto the “3” timer card and circle the word they will be using. All other players must finish discovering their words before the timer runs out. The player who turned the timer over may not continue to write new words. When the final timer expires, everyone makes sure they have one word circled from their list and will be the word they submit for the round.

Custom scoring commences and the game is played over 10 rounds.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pacific Crucible Naval Battles of the Pacific
boardgame.description:
Pacific Crucible picks up where Jay Boyer Carrier Battles and Iron Samurai left off. Pacific Crucible includes the Basic, Advanced, and Optional rules for Carrier Battles, and Basic Game Rules for The Iron Samurai for Naval Battles.

Pacific Crucible is a historical simulation of Navy warfare fought between, the Air, Naval, and Land forces of the Imperial Japanese Empire and the Allied forces during World War II. Pacific Crucible covers the aircraft carrier operations in detail, along with the surface actions. We have a large allotment of scenarios both historical and hypothetical with an extended campaign system.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Carrier Battles: The Struggle for Guadalcanal

boardgame.name: Gauntlet of Doom
boardgame.description:
Traps, more traps, and even more fiendish traps! Sure, you'll have a chance to fight, but if you want to be the ruler of the city of Gaxarn in Zimrala, you have to prove that you can survive when everything is trying to kill you. Come to think of it, that's a good description of fantasy world politics. Everything is trying to kill you.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Monsterary of Zimrala Preview
boardgame.description:
This free preview book of The Monsterary gives you a sample of this new Bestiary and world for use with Monsters! Monsters or any RPG.
The preview contains an Introduction by Sekhmet the Cat goddess, 4 fully described monsters, a full color map of Zimrala, a detailed map of the Southern region with descriptions, a list of the main intelligent species to be found on Zimrala, and additional info on what else will be in the final 172 page Monstersary of Zimrala tome.
Fans of Ken St Andre’s rpg games have been demanding a Bestiary and now here is your first glimpse at the wonders it holds in store for you. This is part of the Kickstarter that is going on right now. Be sure to check that out and pledge today - while you still can... Links to the Kickstarter are in this free booklet

Eye candy and a special treat for all fantasy role-players, and especially for those who play Monsters! Monsters! or Tunnels and Trolls

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Bunter Abend
boardgame.description:
This is a compendium of small games and quizzes for the family to emulate a tv-show. After each game points are awarded and counted by moving meeples on a counting sheet showing spaces 1 - 90.

There are quizz questions for the themes "Fairy tales and legends", "Sports and games", "Various", "Music" and "History". Additionaly there are geographical questions in the categories Europe, Asia, Africa, America and Australia.

There are games with dice, a spinner, a rod and line, a catapult for flying hats and so on.

If a player reaches certain spaces on the counting sheet he has to solve a task to get extra points. The first player to reach 90 points wins the game.

The game was published in the 1960s.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Field Catalogue
boardgame.description:
The Field Catalogue presents a selection of weaponry and equipment to suit all budgets and requirements, from handguns to grav tanks, from boots to starships. For those wanting something special the weapon design system puts custom firepower in the hands of your mercenaries. Balance knockdown power against armour penetration and magazine capacity; magazine capacity against the ability to get a shot on target before the opposition fires back.

This book also has rules for situations the average Traveller never encounters: chemical warfare, standoff missile attacks, artillery bombardment and manoeuvring under fire on a low-gravity planetoid. Among the force-multipliers and problem solvers in the Field Catalogue are distraction grenades, auto-hacking intrusion devices and thermal concealment coverings. Personal weaponry ranges from the ubiquitous ‘Mark 1’ handgun to top-end gauss sniping weapons.

For those with a bigger budget, the Field Catalogue presents a range of vehicles with options packages. The basic Negav 10-wheel truck is a humble logistics vehicle, but for a few thousand Credits more it can become a mobile headquarters or improvised ground assault platform. The S-series grav platform can transport troops to the battle area or provide support with its autocannon and Blackjack gun/missile system. The very richest commanders can travel in style aboard the Gravitas skiff or take command of a Shadow gunship for more direct action.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-Earth – BGExpansions Full Scenery Pack
boardgame.description: A collection of detailed scenery tokens to play the base game the Shadowed Paths and the Spreading WarTM expansion.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-Earth
The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-earth – Shadowed Paths Expansion
The Lord of the Rings: Journeys in Middle-Earth – Spreading War Expansion

boardgame.name: Adventure Codex
boardgame.description:
Triple Ace Games is proud to announce a series of epic hardback books which contain the adventures previously published by TAG. The second book to be published in the Codex range is the Daring Tales of Adventure Codex (Codex II)

Daring Tales of Adventure Codex containssixteen two-fisted pulp adventures for the award-winning Savage Worlds roleplaying game.

In this edition you will find the following adventures:


To End All Wars & Chaos In Crete
Web Of The Spider Cult
Treasure Of The Templars
The Talons Of Lo-Peng
Sky Pirates Of The Caribbean
The Palladium Peril
The Twelfth Gate
Terror Of The Z-Bomb
Island Of Terror
Kingdom Of The Blood Gods
The Hands Of Kali
Legacy Of Tunguska
The Devil’s Chalice
The Sword Of Avalon
The Muramasa Curse
Empire Of The Black Pharaoh


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Town & Gear
boardgame.description:
Before embarking on your thru-hike, pack your bag with essential gear to help you handle the most extreme weather, maximize your energy, and your enjoyment points! Don’t forget to stop off and tour the towns, repack your bag, and much more!

There are 16 different polyomino-shaped gear, each with a unique shape, size, and ability! With a bagful of goodies, you'll be able to mitigate dice rolls, avoid negative effects of weather, and break some rules entirely!

Towns along the trail offer new and powerful actions that you can use! You can Tour the Town, send a postcard to a friend, and rest and recover like never before! You can also repack your bag with your favorite gear and take advantage of new and interesting scoring opportunities!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Adventures of the Pulp Age!
boardgame.description:
Movie matinees. Dime novels. Comic books. Cheesy stories. Remember when bizarre was the norm and you never knew what was around the corner? The classic adventure stories never went away. Now, you can relive them in your gaming sessions with our Adventures of the Pulp Age!

This book combines three highly-praised adventures packed chock full of action and adventure:

- You'll face martial artists, sky pirates, alien gods, and flying jellyfish witches in Prison of the Dragon God...
- Then challenge warrior women, dinosaurs, ancient tribes, and techno-organic sorcery in Terror Planet of the Amazon Queen...
- And finish with Nazis, mutants, and undead prophets in Rifles of Atlantis!

All of these adventures were written to present not just a plot, but an entire mini-setting, full of adventure hooks for exploration and development.

And to top it all off, we've added some exclusive content. The book contains:

- Tips on writing and running B-movie and pulp-style adventures.
- New setting rules, Edges and Hindrances
cleardot.gif
- A discussion of magic in pulps, plus a new Arcane Background: Lucha Libre for Savage Worlds!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Not All Of Us Made It
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Stranger wears the Pallid Mask, the Stranger says he wears no mask.

In The Yellow King RPG, our world is invaded by the malignant, cancerous reality-warping influence of Carcosa and the dreaded King in Yellow.In the Aftermath setting, the Yellow King and his minions, the Castaigne regime, have been driven from America, and the shattered nation must be rebuilt as it comes to terms with the cosmic horrors unleashed by the King’s presence.

In this one-shot adventure for Aftermath, the revolution happened six months ago. The characters are survivors of the nightmarish incarceration camp at Fort Hyades, who have gathered at a support meeting when they are nearly killed by a bomb. When the police are singularly unhelpful, they have to investigate for themselves.

boardgame.name: Cannabis Conflict
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party rolls into a new town and finds themselves in the middle of a drug gang dispute. The party will have to decide which side to take or perhaps...take over the whole business! Originally done as a 4/20 gag scenario on Murder Hobo Inc. it had hilarious results.

The scenario was designed for a quartet of third level PCs.

boardgame.name: The Forest Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What foul beast dwells here?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30x50 battlemaps depicting a cave lair in the forest. Forest trails lead to a cave in the cliff face - with the home of a monster or beast within. Two versions are provided - surface and interior (grid and no grid), plus a PNG overlay with the land above the cave.

boardgame.name: Harshmoor House
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bleak house sits not far from the road that winds across the moorland.

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level 50x50 map consisting of a two storey house in a bleak, lonely moorland setting. Includes roof (as full map and overlay)

boardgame.name: Evolution: Butterfly Effect
boardgame.description:
Every ecosystem is a complex combination of living organisms and the environment. Even a small change in any element affects the entire system, but balance is usually restored quickly. However, sometimes a random event leads to the butterfly effect – an unpredictable cascade of changes that can completely transform the whole biosphere.

The Butterfly Effect expansion gives you a new and unique way to play Evolution: New World. In the box, you’ll find:
- 13 new traits and the Seashore Area. Add more gameplay depth and create dynamic survival strategies for your animals.
- The Solo mode. In the Alien World scenario you will fight 1 on 1 against the merciless Dominator and insatiable Devastator for supremacy or create your own monsters to compete with.
- Additional tokens. With the expansion, up to 6 players can enjoy Evolution together.
- Butterfly Effect scenario. Start a chain reaction of random events that affect the game’s course and change the evolutionary process.

boardgame.name: In Mahan's Wake
boardgame.description:
In Mahan's Wake is ATG’s third supplement for Dawn of the Battleship. It has thirty-one scenarios, a mix of historical battles, like the Sino-Japanese War, near-historical (“almost happened”), and fictional scenarios.

The latter include a series of scenarios called the Great Maritime War of 1899, by William Le Queux, one of the many “war scare” books of that period (the techno-thrillers of that age). The story line was converted into playable scenarios by the knowledgeable Bob Eldridge, who unfortunately passed away in 2017. Mike Harris, his co-author, has finished the work.

In addition to the scenarios, the book includes annexes covering all the ships and weapons required to play them.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dawn of the Battleship: Tactical Naval Warfare

boardgame.name: The Proxima Wars
boardgame.description:
Battlefield Press, Inc presents a science fiction campaign setting for Savage Worlds set in Stewart Cowley's Terran Trade Authority. This first book, The Proxima War written by Jonathan M. Thompson and Jeffery Lily, gives details from Earth's first contact to the aftermath of the war. Details will be presented on the military advances, the descriptions of the aliens and all the ships from the book Spacecraft 2000 to 2100 AD.

This setting book gives you:


Background on the major races
Details on how to build each of the major races as characters - Aphans, Proximans and Terrans
Savage Worlds stat blocks on the ships in Spacecraft 2000-2100
Detailed timeline of events


- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: The Terran Trade Authority Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Curse of the Kobold Eye (Savage Worlds)
boardgame.description:
An unusual curse from their last brush with danger befalls a party of adventurers! Haunted by the spectral image of a one-eyed kobold warrior, the heroes must race to unravel the mystery of the curse while avoiding death at the hands of their ghostly visitor. Can they stop the effects of the curse in time before it consumes them entirely? A harrowing journey awaits them!

WK2 Curse of the Kobold Eye is the second adventure in Cut to the Chase Games’ Fantasy Renaissance Module Adventure module trilogy, WRATH OF THE KOBOLDS. It is designed for a group of 4 to 6 characters levels 2 to 4. The GM should read the module thoroughly before playing to become familiar with the overall plot of the adventure.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Complete Thaumaturgic Codex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Complete Thaumaturgic Codex contains 77 spells and 46 magic items for the 5th edition of world's greatest roleplaying game. Many of these spells first appeared in Bloodstone's earlier 3rd edition and Pathfinder titles. They have now all been revised and updated to 5th edition.

All 20 spells from The Thaumaturgic Codex Book I including:
Dissipation. Help your enemies be in two places at once by teleporting only *some* of them away!
Kaleidoscopic Strike. A burst of mind bending colors sends your weakest enemies to their graves. Those strong enough to survive are left stricken with psychedelic trauma.
Malefic Susurrations. This spell fills your voice with horrific, rasping noises from the lower planes.
Encumbering Load. Pit the strength of your mind against the strength of your opponent's back! See them crushed under your mighty intellect!
Soul Smite. Make sure they feel your attacks deep, deep inside!

All 20 spells from the Thaumaturgic Codex Book II including:
Beastly Transformation. Turn your pet cat or dog into a deadly beast!
Storm Door. Need to thicken the "fog of war?" Open a storm door and fill the area with ferocious demons!
Creeping Shadows. Who needs friends when your enemies are delusional?
Concussive Blast. Surrounded? We've got a spell for that. Enemies are better when they are 20 feet away, prone, and bleeding.
Rainbow Warriors. Imbue your targets with powers associated with the color you assign them. The Red Warrior spills blood while the Blue Warrior wields magical cold.
Shadow Spray. Seven shades of darkness spray from your hands and render your enemies cursed, paralyzed, or dead!

All 20 spells from the Thaumaturgic Codex Book III including:
Diaphanous Shift. Become ghostly and transparent, gaining resistance to weapon damage with this 3rd level spell.
Labyrinthine Conundrum. Preoccupy your enemies with a contagious, unsolvable riddle!
Salty Wounds. Inflict debilitating pain upon your injured foes!
Soul Power. Bolster yourself or your allies! Gain protection from necrotic damage and bonuses on your d20 rolls!
Rolling Rock. A small boulder emerges from the earth and rolls over your enemies!
Terra Form. Become a giant, stone creature, infused with the power of the earth!

All 37 items from 37 Magic Items including:
Boots of the Mounted Champion. Ride any beast!
Blanket of Solace. Protects you from the cold and from your enemies!
Compass of Direction. This handy compass finds a lot more than magnetic North!
Headband of Thought Projection. Create 3D images of your thoughts!
Net of Negation. The perfect weapon for anyone hunting witches, wizards, or sorcerers!

BONUS CONTENT
The Complete Thaumaturgic Codex also features content that has never been released in any other format.

17 new spells including:
Defensive Screen. Take cover behind these whirling discs of force!
Disembowel. Make your enemies spill their guts!
Flaming Vortex. Fire is bad. Winds make it worse!
Ineffectual Attacks. Bend reality to soften your enemy’s attacks!
Instant Karma. It’ll get you every time!

9 new magic items including:
Figurines of Wondrous Power. (Granite Ape, Sandstone Camel, and Turquoise Turtle)
Drums of Dancing. When you hear that rhythm, you've just got to move!
Warning Statue. These statues are placed near the entrances to important buildings and alert their owners to intruders!

The School of Shadow

The school of shadow is a mix of necromancy, darkness, and dimensional magic. It includes abilities for wizards that specialize in shadow and a spell list that repurpose some OGL spells and uses several of the new spells presented in this Complete Thaumaturgic Codex.

boardgame.name: One-Pager Collection: On the Outskirts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One-Pager Collection: On the Outskirts is a collection of one-page dungeons designed to be compatible with any OSR (Old School Revival) rule set, such as Knave, Old-School Essentials, and a whole host of other minimalist RPGs.

Contained within are 4 one-page adventure modules, all designed to be system-neutral and setting-neutral, making them the perfect addition to existing hex crawls and campaigns. Additionally, 5 new monster stat blocks, 2 new magic items and 2 reference maps round out the adventures to make them truly unique experiences.

boardgame.name: Gemwielders
boardgame.description:
Gemwielders is a deckbuilding game, boasting interactive gameplay and high replayability.

You are a Gemwielder, capable of controlling ancient artifacts called Gembearers. Powerful by themselves, only by socketing them with magical gems will you acquire mighty abilities that allow you to prevail in a duel with another Gemwielder.

Gemwielders is designed around interaction from the ground up. The innovative combat system allows the attack and defense cards to clash each turn and interact meaningfully. You need to consider your attack patterns and draft decisions carefully, taking the strategy and defense setup of your opponent into account.

Each game you adapt to the cards that appear and craft a new deck with a unique color combination. You form a plan on the fly, discover synergies that match your play style and go well with the abilities of your favorite Gembearer. If you keep an open mind and seize the presented opportunities, you will be rewarded.

All you need to play a game of Gemwielders are two Gembearers and five Gems, as included in the Core Set. While new Gems and Gembearers are introduced, the number of Gems used in a single game remain the same. Through random combination of the available pieces, never seen situations emerge each game.

All cards are illustrated traditionally in pencil, ink and watercolor, giving the game a unique and mature feel. Combined with the haptic and visual satisfacition of gems being placed on Gembearers, this makes for a truly exceptional playing experience.

boardgame.name: Kiekko.tk
boardgame.description: Kiekko.tk is a java-based ice hockey game. Every player takes control of one player in the rink. The player is controlled by a mouse. Goalies cannot be controlled, as they are computer controlled. To practice, players can join training rooms where players are allowed to leave the rink whenever they see fit. Players can also join a team and play team matches. Players are able to spectate these matches as well as training matches. By clicking and holding the left mouse button, the puck can be passed or shot. By clicking the right mouse button, an automatic pass is sent to a teammate closest to the cursor the moment the right mouse button is released. To increase the competition of the game, members have organised leagues.

boardgame.name: College Bound - Episode 1
boardgame.description:
An adult game currently in development that features over 20 uniquely modeled and detailed female characters with high-quality, fully animated scenes.

Plot
After two years of working your ass off in college, you finally managed to qualify for an international student exchange program, which also guarantees you a generous scholarship. It was supposed to be a hell of a year-long adventure – you and your girlfriend Summer (who made the cut as well) together in sweet, sweet Paris. Sounds nice, doesn’t it? Well, maybe if the principal didn’t suddenly exclude you from the program completely. That bitch.

What caused her last-minute decision that’s threatening to ruin your relationship and year of adventure? Will you be able to resolve the situation, or provide for yourself without the scholarship? Are you and Summer going to be able to endure the long-distance test or will the plentiful temptations be too hard for you to resist?

Find answers to these questions (and many more as they unravel) on your own, as the choices you make in College Bound will impact the story with each and every update.

The game is a visual novel in-progress, utilizing classic Ren’py controls and containing high-quality renders
as well as fully-animated, non-censored adult scenes.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: College Bound: Arctic Adventure
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An official spin-off to College Bound where you take a flight to Iceland: a cold climate with hot girls. Blanca, Summer, Jess, Lynda, and Amber from College Bound are all featured in this game - as well as five new people to meet while solving a mystery.

boardgame.name: FreshWomen
FreshWomen - Season 1
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





User Summary

Trying to find out what happened to your father you have an accident which erase some of your memory.
Therefore you move to a new town to start college as a freshman.

boardgame.name: Darts 'n Dice
boardgame.description:
A dice game, like darts! Move your pawns across a round dartboard-style board, and try to occupy the scoring spots. A bit of luck is needed, but you'll never make it without tactics - and there's those pesky cards to consider as well.

A family game of dice and tactics.

boardgame.name: Flock 'Em
boardgame.description:
A "trick taking", "take that", "head to head" or scalable to "full party" card game of avian revenge.

Players get their own special deck whose composition is the same as their opponents but themed differently, with custom art for their flock of quirk fowl, unhelpful humans, and oddball felines.

Players then take turns calling out actions (bird calls?) that everyone at the table must do or be forced to discard a card. Players may call out actions to add cards their everyone's hands, attack and claim the ever growing pile of humans who invade their world, and try to assemble their mighty bridforce in a flying V formation.

Play continues in this manner until one player meets one of two conditions, either a full flying v formation (explained in more detail in the rules) or runs out of cards to add to their flock. Players then tabulate points to see who has flown to the top and is the new APEX FLOCKER!

Flock together. Fly in formation. Swoop to victory. If the humans don't like it...Flock 'em.

boardgame.name: Unique Locations: Collection 04
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether encountered on a quest, or simply found while traveling from here to there, feel free to add these unique locations to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Locations include:

The Cathedral whose arches may be planar portals
Underhill, where something may have recently broken in - or out
An underground Sanctuary in a destroyed city in the woods
A lost city emerging from the sands of the desert

boardgame.name: Dodeca
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dodeca is a d12 based grimdark roleplaying game that embraces the mood and feel of Old School Roleplaying, but with modern mechanics and tools.

Through rolling or choice, every player gets five narrative prompts to build their character's Legend. These provide attribute points and skills, but also give a view into their drive, desires and origin. Creating characters together can help to flesh out their story, plus add some character specific flavour ahead of building your grimdark world.

Much like characters, the world through which you explore and struggle can be created collaboratively by generating or choosing narrative prompts. Will you be questing across a fantasy land controlled by a cruel overlord, fighting the fascist authorities of a dystopian future or evading cannibal bikers on the shattered roads of a post-apocalyptic world. Dodeca allows you to build this grimdark world together!

boardgame.name: WWII Wewelsburg Contingent
boardgame.description:
Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Wewelsburg Contingent

Wewelsburg Castle was a mysterious base for the SS during World War II. The Nazis were known to conduct strange experiments there, the true extent of which is unknown. Cast of Cards: Wewelsburg Contingent takes your players into that castle and populates it with men and monsters from the Third Reich!

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters

boardgame.name: Read My List!
boardgame.description:
Read My List is a category-association game in which players draw cards and provide three more examples of things that would fit a given list of words, name the category of a list of words, or take turns naming a word from a category until no one can come up with anymore.

In each round, the reading player draws a card from the box. The card will be one of three types of cards: List, Category or Lightning Round. Every card also has a Beginner side (blue) and an advanced side (red). The reader gets to decided which difficulty they want the players to play that round.

List cards offer a list of a number of items (e.g., the "Cheeses" list card lists Brie, Jack, Colby, goat, etc.). To score points the other players must provide three more items that fit the list's category, but are NOT on the card.

For Category cards, the reader slowly reads each item in the list as the other players shout out guesses as to what the category is—for instance the reader could be reading "lookout", "thief", "map", "parrot", and so on, and if a player correctly guessed "pirates", they would earn points.

The Lightning Round cards simply provide a subject (e.g., "Celebrities") after which players take turns quickly providing a thing that matches the subject. If a player can't come up with something quickly enough they are out. The last player to provide a timely answer gets the points.

The object of the game is to be the first player to score 5 points.

boardgame.name: Volters Lead the Way!
boardgame.description:
The flashes of light from the explosions on Mars could be seen clearly in the night sky. Terror reigned on Earth as it became obvious that the solar system was under attack by an alien menace. If the general populace knew the true nature of the threat, their fears would have become almost incapacitating. Mars was under assault from alien beings who apparently have existed in the universe for trillions of years and have evolved over that period to become technologically superior to humans – as well as every other lifeform in the galaxy. This alien race had become known as the “Fermitians”, named after the astronomer Enrico Fermi and author of the Fermi Paradox. And that’s because these beings were essentially the answer to the paradox. They brazenly demonstrated that the reason we have been unaware of other alien species for so long is simply because the Fermitians have been exterminating them! And next on their “hit list” is humanity and its entire solar system. Their initial target was the newly populated planet of Mars, but there are also rumors that a secondary alien invasion fleet has been secretly deployed to seize a celestial body much nearer and dearer to Earthlings … the Moon.

The only force capable of dealing with this threat is the famed 324th Volter Regiment, an elite fighting formation that was created just for this kind of mission. With the support of the Starcruiser “Skybreach”, the Volters have been sent to Mars and the Moon to stop the Fermitians from destroying these critically important places with their Doomsday Devices. Can you put an end to this threat, Commander? It’s up to you…

Volters Lead the Way! is an exciting solitaire/cooperative game in which you, as the Commander of the 324th Volter Regiment, must lead your troops across the map board, defeat defending alien forces and stop the countdown that has been set in motion. If the Doomsday Device goes off, Mars and its colony settlements, or the Moon and its research stations, will be destroyed. Godspeed and good luck!

Volters Lead the Way! uses a unique "push-your-luck" game mechanic that drives the action and challenges you to balance risk and reward. The game is highly re-playable with two maps (Mars and the Moon), variable alien and terrain setups, nine types of alien units, four types of Volter units, customized Volter Companies and random events. The game includes three Scenarios each with three Difficulty Level options (Easy, Standard and Brutal). Though primarily a solitaire game, there are also 2-player and 3-player cooperative play options.

–description from designer

boardgame.name: Emily is Away <3
boardgame.description:
Emily is Away <3
It's 2008 and AIM is dead.Better sign up for this Facenook thing everyone's talking about.

Customize your profile, send some friend requests and determine the outcome of your senior year.


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: At the Helm
boardgame.description:
A heavy nautical theme game inspired by the old captain's ship logs. Often in these ship logs you'd see drawings and we used that as inspiration. It's solo and it's a deckbuilder.

—description from the publisher


A 15 minute game in which you captain your sailboat through various challenges of the open ocean.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fields of Green: Game Makers Insert
boardgame.description:
This is a carefully designed, awesome looking, 3d printed insert for Fields of Green board game by Artipia Games.

It consists of 16 different parts and can accommodate the Base Game, the Grand Fair expansion as well as the promo material of both Kickstarter campaigns.

The individual trays of all cards and tokens can be taken out of the box, placed on the table and be used in your games right away, minimizing setup times.
